docs.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on Friday, October 13, 2017.
It’s Christmas Eve: Go big with a goose, if you’re celebrating, then get back to normal with an arroz con pollo risotto and a chicken schnitzel.
Cook a little, even if you’ll be at the movies, and make some late-morning pancakes, or pimento cheese sandwiches.
‘If everyone follows trends, then we will all look the same, and what fun is that?’
Mr. Adler spent much of his career at WCBS-AM, where he anchored the news and also served as the station’s news director.

headline.print_headline: Lou Adler, 88, a Fixture of Radio News With WCBS Newsradio in New York
headline.main: Lou Adler, a Fixture of New York Radio News, Dies at 88

docs.snippet: Our director of NYT Global went live on Facebook on Wednesday to discuss how The Times reports the news for an international audience.

docs.snippet: Oxford Dictionaries’ Word of the Year drew some bafflement and derision. We asked readers to do better.

docs.snippet: A New Orleans family is ready to buy the annual gathering of the bar and spirits world, after its founders resigned amid accusations of racism.

docs.snippet: After years of destruction in Qaraqosh, Iraq’s largest Christian enclave, residents are rebuilding and preparing for Christmas.

headline.main: Christmas Returns to a City Liberated From ISIS
